The claim made by Sen: Renee Unterman that state Senate leaders have accepted $142,400 in campaign contributions from dentists and pharmacists during the past two years.
The opposition of Sen: Unterman to House Bill 132, which would transfer regulatory duties for dentists, dental hygienists, and pharmacists from the Secretary of State to the Department of Community Health.
The posting of a graphic by Sen: Unterman during a speech, which detailed the amount of money received by some senators from dentists, pharmacists, and their political action committees.
The verification process conducted by Po: which involved examining the contributions provided by Sen. Unterman and conducting their own research to confirm the total amount of more than $142,000.
